DataElement.preferredDefinition: Name of imaging procedure used in the visualization of any tissue or organ for use in screening or treatment settings.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Tests that produce pictures of areas inside the body.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 11/3/14 per discussion with Dianne Reeves, removed C38101 (Radiography) as qualifier for consistency with existing imaging content and to support non-Radiography imaging techniques used in RECIST measurement. jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure proposed by Wolchok et al. (Clin Cancer Res 2009;15:7412-7420) to determine the extent of an antitumor response to a particular immunotherapeutic agent.

Concepts.longName: Modified Overall Immune Related Response Criterion
Concepts.definition: A measure proposed by Wolchok et al. (Clin Cancer Res 2009;15:7412-7420) to determine the extent of an antitumor response to a particular immunotherapeutic agent.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)

Concepts.longName: Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: Standard parameters to be used when documenting response of solid tumors to treatment; a set of published rules that define when cancer patients improve ("respond"), stay the same ("stable"), or worsen ("progression") during treatments. (from www.recist.com)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Immunotherapy Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Immunotherapy Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Response assessment criteria for the evaluation of patients undergoing immunotherapy for the treatment of malignant glioma. These recommendations integrate guidance for the determination and confirmation of tumor progression based on the response assessment in neuro-oncology (RANO) working group and the immune-related response criteria (irRC).

Concepts.longName: Immunotherapy Response Assessment in Neuro-Oncology Criteria
Concepts.definition: Response assessment criteria for the evaluation of patients undergoing immunotherapy for the treatment of malignant glioma. These recommendations integrate guidance for the determination and confirmation of tumor progression based on the response assessment in neuro-oncology (RANO) working group and the immune-related response criteria (irRC).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A radiographic procedure using the emission of x-rays to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation.:Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic procedure using the emission of x-rays to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation.
Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

DataElement.changeDescription: 2/16/15 released per 1/28 email from Dianne Reeves. jc  11/6/14 removed reference to DCP as origin; added DCI For Review CS/CSI; CDE released. jc 11/3/14 per discussion with Dianne Reeves, removed C38101 (Radiography) as qualifier for consistency with existing imaging content and to support non-Radiography imaging techniques used in RECIST measurement. jc  10/30/14 Curated to support Duke Cancer Center clinical trial. dr
